info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 25 at 1:42AM CDT until October 25 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN DE SOTO...SOUTHEASTERN CADDO AND CENTRAL BOSSIER PARISHES... At 141 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Benton to near Shreveport to 10 miles southwest of Stonewall, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Haughton, Benton, Stonewall, Eastwood, Fosters, Keachi, Grand Cane, Alden Bridge, Ferguson, Fillmore, Bodcau, Kingston, Kickapoo, Keithville, Ivan, Mc Dade, Reeds Store and Gloster. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
